feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 15 at 6:17AM AKDT until March 15 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills to 55 below zero expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Central Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Until noon.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 15 at 6:17AM AKDT until March 15 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills to 55 below zero expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Northeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until noon.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 4:52AM AKDT until March 15 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Local areas of light freezing drizzle glazing surfaces. * WHERE...Juneau Area. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 15 at 2:21AM AKDT until March 15 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT TODAY... * WHAT...Cold wind chills 40 to 50 below zero expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Southeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until noon.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued March 14 at 2:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM AKDT TUESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is in effect from 9 PM this evening to 11 AM AKDT Tuesday. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 9:58AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. * WHEN...Until noon CDT.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued March 15 at 4:06AM CDT until March 17 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...In Alabama, Baldwin Coastal and Mobile Coastal Counties. In Florida, Santa Rosa Coastal, Okaloosa Coastal and Escambia Coastal Counties.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 15 at 6:11AM PDT until March 15 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Very long to long period west-northwest swell, sneaker waves and strong rip currents from coastal Sonoma County to coastal Monterey County through 7 PM PDT Tuesday... .Very long to long period west-northwest swell impacting the coast from Sonoma County to coastal Monterey County resulting in a high risk of sneaker waves and strong rip currents. Swell
entry.cap:areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued March 15 at 4:39AM PDT until March 17 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 9 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West facing beaches of San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued March 15 at 3:40AM PDT until March 16 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Mojave Desert Slopes. * WHEN...From noon today until 9 AM PDT Wednesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Breezy with Rain Showers and Mountain Snow This Morning Followed By Another Storm System Moving Through This Weekend... * Wind: Gusty west-southwest winds will occur tonight into Tuesday with gusts on the order of 25-30 MPH for most areas. entry.title: Avalanche Warning issued March 15 at 8:53AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: The Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center in Sandpoint has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: Boundary and Bonner counties in the Idaho Panhandle. * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will rise to High today, Tuesday, March 15th. * WHERE...Boundary and Bonner counties in the Idaho Panhandle.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued March 15 at 1:37AM CDT until March 15 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS LIKELY TODAY... .A surge of warm dry air will move north and east out of Colorado Tuesday leading to gusty winds and low afternoon humidity across western and north central Nebraska. Grasslands across the region are unusually dry and weather conditions will be favorable for rapid fire growth with any fire starts.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 3:19AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Wind Likely today... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service in Riverton. * WHAT...Southwest wind 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. Occasional gusts to around 60 mph are possible in the wind prone areas on the south side of Casper.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 3:08AM MDT until March 16 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to noon MDT Wednesday. The heaviest

entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins, and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued March 15 at 2:04AM MDT until March 16 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...East Platte County including Wheatland and Glendo. * WHEN...Until Midnight MDT Tuesday night.
